pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:5.1: 23. The training rule on sewing robes
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:6.2: At that time a robe had been badly made and badly sewn from the expensive robe-cloth belonging to a certain nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:6.3: The nun Thullanandā then said to her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:6.5: but the robe is badly made and badly sewn.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:6.6: “If I unstitch it, will you sew it?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:6.8: Then that nun unstitched the robe and gave it to Thullanandā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:6.9: However, although Thullanandā repeatedly said she would sew it,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:6.10: she neither sewed it herself, nor did she make any effort to get someone else to sew it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:7.1: That nun then told the nuns what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:7.2: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:7.4: “How could Venerable Thullanandā have another nun’s robe unstitched, and then neither sew it herself, nor make any effort to get someone else to sew it?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:7.5: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:7.8: How can the nun Thullanandā have another nun’s robe unstitched, and then neither sew it herself, nor make any effort to get someone else to sew it?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:7.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:7.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:8.1: ‘If a nun, after unstitching another nun’s robe or getting it unstitched, neither sews it herself nor makes any effort to get someone else to sew it, then, unless there was an obstruction or it was just a period of four or five days, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:11.2: one of the six kinds of robe.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:12.4: she gets someone else to unstitch it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:14.2: she does not sew it herself.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:14.3: Nor makes any effort to get someone else to sew:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:14.4: she does not ask anyone else.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:15.1: Unless […] it was just a period of four or five days:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:15.2: except for a period of four or five days.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:15.3: If she thinks, “I will not sew it, nor make any effort to get someone else to sew it,” then by the mere fact of giving up the duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:16.1: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as such, and she unstitches her robe or gets it unstitched, and then neither sews it herself nor makes any effort to get someone else to sew it, then, unless there was an obstruction or it was just a period of four or five days, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:16.2: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure if she is, and she unstitches her robe or gets it unstitched, and then neither sews it herself nor makes any effort to get someone else to sew it, then, unless there was an obstruction or it was just a period of four or five days, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:16.3: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she unstitches her robe or gets it unstitched, and then neither sews it herself nor makes any effort to get someone else to sew it, then, unless there was an obstruction or it was just a period of four or five days, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:17.1: If she unstitches another requisite or gets it unstitched, and then neither sews it herself nor makes any effort to get someone else to sew it, then, unless there was an obstruction or it was just a period of four or five days, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:17.2: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she unstitches her robe or another requisite, or gets it unstitched, and then neither sews it herself nor makes any effort to get someone else to sew it, then, unless there was an obstruction or it was just a period of four or five days, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:17.3: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:17.4: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:17.5: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:18.2: if she is the first offender.
